sqlpetr 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference

Get a DBI connection string to a PostgreSQL database, waiting if it is not ready

Source: R/sp_get_postgres_connection.R
sp_get_postgres_connection.Rd

This function connects to an instance of PostgreSQL.

sp_get_postgres_connection(user, password, dbname, host = "localhost",
  port = "5432", seconds_to_test = 10)

Arguments

user

Username for connecting to the database
password

Password that corresponds to the username
dbname

The name of the database within the database server
host

The IP address or host where postgreSQL is located, defaults to "localhost"
port

The port on the host that postgreSQL listens to, defaults to "5432"
seconds_to_test

The number of iterations to try while waiting for PostgreSQL service to be ready.

Value

When successful: a connection object, which is an S4 object that inherits from DBIConnection used to communicate with the database engine; Otherwise, an error string.

Examples

con <- sp_get_postgres_connection("postgres", "postgres")

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value
  • Examples
